file_content.text: Speak to Major Bessiker, the chief resources officer on Balmorra, and figure out how to get to the bottom of that vault.
Is that you, apprentice? Excellent. You've arrived safely on Balmorra, I see.
How was your first flight in that wonderful ship of yours? I hope you found it pleasant.
I think I'm going to be sick.
I feel woozy.
Well, take a moment, relax. A long space flight can be disorienting.
Very.
Excellent. I had hoped you'd enjoy it.
The ship's a piece of junk.
It was terrible.
I'm sure you'll find plenty of ways to modify it to your tastes.
Now, I hope you're ready to work. I've got a good idea of where the ancient artifact is on Balmorra, but it's not pleasant.
Fill me in.
Yes, well, let's just say circumstances have changed since Tulak Hord hid his artifact.
I'm not worried.
Good--this is not a task for the easily unsettled.
You mean like a rancor with a rash or...?
How unpleasant?
You have a vivid imagination, apprentice.
Tulak Hord hid his artifact in a vault on Balmorra, one that was later converted by the Balmorrans into a toxic waste storage facility.
But the vault was hit badly in the last war. It's now a crater, filled with toxic waste. Your artifact is at the bottom.
You must have some sort of plan for how to get it, right?
I'm open to suggestions.
Regrettably, I haven't had time to put together a plan. You'll have to figure this one out yourself.
I have the worst luck.
You've done the impossible before; you'll do it again.
I'll just get some diving gear and go.
Wonderful.
If only it were that simple. I'm afraid the waste would kill even you, my apprentice.
But try making contact with the Imperial resources officer here on Balmorra, Major Bessiker.
Bessiker knows the planet, and he may even have a few good ideas.
You want me to work with an Imperial?
Non-Sith are beneath me.
He will do whatever I say.
I will bend him.
Not likely.
Those who succeed without the Force make up for what they lack with a certain resourcefulness. Don't write Bessiker off.
But don't tell the major about the artifact. Its existence is not common knowledge, and I'd like to keep it that way.
Careful you don't alienate a potential ally.
The Empire has its hands full coping with a violent Balmorran uprising. Officially, they're a grassroots militia. Secretly, they have the Republic's full backing.
I've informed Major Bessiker of the Republic's involvement, so he will be better equipped to assist you. No doubt the Republic's hounds will get in your way.
Republic or resistance. It makes no difference to me.
I'm not concerned.
The Republic may claim to be virtuous, but they have a well-oiled military machine. These are not farmers waving sticks.
I'll relish beating them.
I expect nothing less.
Why is the Republic's involvement a secret?
Major Bessiker didn't know?
At the end of the last war, the Treaty of Coruscant left Balmorra to the Empire. The Republic cannot risk open involvement without violating the treaty.
But the war is secondary to the artifact. Retrieve the artifact, and try to be discreet. We don't want the entire Sith Order chasing our prize.
